code:
export const news = [{ title: "8 Reasons Bali Is The Best Holiday Destination", img: "View-1.png", timeline: "by admin | Mar 1, 2022 | Uncategorized", content: `

Here are 8 reasons why Bali is the best holiday destination.

  1. Bali has friendly people
  2. Bali is a safe tourist destination
  3. Bali has exotic natural beauty
  4. Bali has very adequate accommodation
  5. Bali has beautiful and unique tourist attractions
  6. Bali is a shopping paradise for tourists
  7. Bali is a cheap with top quality world travel destination
  8. Bali has everything
`, thumbnail: `Here are 8 reasons why Bali is the best holiday destination. Bali has friendly people Bali is a safe tourist destination Bali has exotic natural beauty Bali has very adequate accommodation...` }, { title: "Indonesia As The Most Beautiful Country In The World", img: "View-2.png", timeline: "by admin | Mar 1, 2022 | Uncategorized", content: `

(Time Out Magazine Version)

Recently, Indonesia was named the most beautiful country by the World Magazine based in London, England, namely Time Out Magazine.

Indonesia ranks the top of the list of the most beautiful countries in the world based on the number of beauties in this country, such as coral reefs, mountains, national parks, and protected forests. However, Indonesia does not only have advantages in terms of natural beauty, but also other attractive places for businessmen and foreign investors to do business and invest in Indonesia. The following are some very interesting things for businessmen, including, among others: 1. Indonesia has very large and abundant natural resources, 2. demographic factors, 3. good economic and investment climate, 4. good political stability, a safe country and 5. Indonesia plays an active role in the global arena, namely actively building bilateral and international relations, where Indonesia is the only country in Southeast Asia that is active in the association of G-20 countries.

For those who want to move to Indonesia and have decided to stay forever, we can help you arrange all the necessary things and get a stay permit that suits to you and your family’s needs.

Please contact us to arrange a meeting schedule at our office to discuss your big plan. Our friendly team will help you step by step realize your dream and big plan.

`, thumbnail: `(Time Out Magazine Version) Recently, Indonesia was named the most beautiful country by the World Magazine based in London, England, namely Time Out Magazine. Indonesia ranks the top of...` }, { title: "What Is The Fine Rate For Overstayed Foreigners?", img: "View-3.png", timeline: "by admin | Mar 1, 2022 | Uncategorized", content: `

The fine rate for overstay in Indonesia is IDR 1,000,000 per day.

To avoid overstay, you should often remember and pay attention to the validity period of your visa, and immediately apply for a visa extension to the local immigration office no later than 7 days before the visa expires. You can do this is if your type of visa is a type of B 211 visit visa, and if your visa is a type of residence visa/KITAS, then you must apply for an extension 1 month before expiration or 2 months before expiration if your visa is a Work Visa/KITAS (Index 312).

`, thumbnail: `The fine rate for overstay in Indonesia is IDR 1,000,000 per day. To avoid overstay, you should often remember and pay attention to the validity period of your visa, and immediately apply...` }, { title: "9 Things You Need To Prepare Before Traveling To Indonesia", img: "View-4.png", timeline: "by admin | Mar 1, 2022 | Uncategorized", content: `

Having an Entry Visa and checking the expiration date

  1. Checking the availability of blank Pages of Passport
  2. Checking the Validity Period of Passport (still valid for no less than 12 months)
  3. Knowing what you can and can’t do with the visa you use
  4. Knowing the sponsor’s name, office address and contact no.
  5. It is recommended to have an invitation letter / reference letter from a sponsoring company
  6. The purpose and objective of coming to Indonesia must be clear.
  7. Bringing all the documents required by an airline company.
  8. Coordinating with airlines to find out what to bring when flying to Indonesia.
`, thumbnail: `Having an Entry Visa and checking the expiration date Checking the availability of blank Pages of Passport Checking the Validity Period of Passport (still valid for no less than 12 months)...` }, { title: "Can foreigners holding a spouse visa/ KITAS work in this country?", img: "View-5.png", timeline: "by admin | Dec 1, 2021 | Uncategorized", content: `

For you who hold a residence visa/spouse KITAS index 317, sponsored by your Indonesian spouse (wife/husband), you are allowed to work in Indonesia after you have a work permit/IMTA issued by the Ministry of Manpower. Holders of Spouse KITAS do not need to change their visa type with a work visa (index 312). Thus, you can continue to use your visa (index 317) and you only need to apply for a work permit/IMTA. Having obtained a work permit/IMTA, you are completely allowed to legally work in Indonesia according to government regulations. Therefore, you will not have any problems with the immigration.

`, thumbnail: 'For you who hold a residence visa/spouse KITAS index 317, sponsored by your Indonesian spouse (wife/husband), you are allowed to work in Indonesia after you have a work permit/IMTA issued...' }, { title: "What Is The Fine Rate For Overstayed Foreigners?", img: "View-6.png", timeline: "by admin | Mar 1, 2022 | Uncategorized", content: `

The fine rate for overstay in Indonesia is IDR 1,000,000 per day.

To avoid overstay, you should often remember and pay attention to the validity period of your visa, and immediately apply for a visa extension to the local immigration office no later than 7 days before the visa expires. You can do this is if your type of visa is a type of B 211 visit visa, and if your visa is a type of residence visa/KITAS, then you must apply for an extension 1 month before expiration or 2 months before expiration if your visa is a Work Visa/KITAS (Index 312).

`, thumbnail: `Holders of KITAP may establish a company and hold the position of director, but cannot become a shareholder in either a local PT or PMDN based on the existing laws and regulations. If you...` }]; export default news;
